TopicTitle: Post your most awesome land base picture here

Articles.Content: I'm really curious to see what's possible.
This sharing of craft has been moved to the craft sharing subforum.

I guess I can weigh in here with a Duna base designed built and constructed using a standardized architecture.  Each module arrived at Duna in a fully enclosed aero-shell with an EDL package bolted to the back of it:

From here the aero-shell would separate and EDL module would detach the drogue chutes:

Next up the skyframe (again a standardized architecture) would deploy main chutes and descent engines would ignite.  Here we see the skyframe deploying with two modules, but it was just as balanced with one:

 

Once landed the tractor module would negotiate it's way carefully under the module and dock to the belly port in the base module.  Here we can see the tractor picking up the first of the two double level base modules:

As you can see each module is fairly substantial, built around sustainable living on the Dunian surface.  The base was located in a highly inclined part of the planet near one of the frozen poles.  Flat ground for landing was limited which necessitated in part the need for a sturdy and capable tractor to lug the modules to the flat base ground to assemble them:

 

From here the assembly job was pretty easy with everything managed perfectly to line up.  All in all 9 modules are landed including an aircraft and long distance rover:

 

Still my best totally hand flown and on planet assembled base to date using a standardized architecture system.

 

SM
